level.text: A submerged aquatic vegetation removal plan may be approved by the Director only for projects which are necessary to do the following:
Provide reasonable access to navigable waters;
Provide reasonable opportunities for water-based recreational activities; and
Manage the living aquatic resources of the waters of the District.
A submerged aquatic vegetation removal plan may be approved by the Director only if the following two (2) criteria are met to the Director’s satisfaction:
The duration of the proposed project is no longer than is necessary to achieve the purpose intended by this chapter; and
The proposed project is consistent with acceptable natural resources and environmental management practices as determined by the Director.
In determining the reasonableness of a plan submitted for approval, the Director may consider the following factors:
The purpose, timing, method and extent of the proposed removal action;
Potential impacts to the living aquatic resources in the project area such as anadromous fish, shellfish, and submerged aquatic vegetation;
The method and location of disposal;
The extent of overall benefit from the proposed project; and
The opinions of affected property owners or others.
